title: Trip to Chicago
content:
Hi folks,

I’m planning a trip to Chicago (about one week) with friends and we’re looking for great things to do concerning graphic design, type and modern arts.

Any idea???

 [‹ Stencil font similar to H&F's Giant](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706223216/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38319 "Go to previous forum topic") [Stainless ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706223216/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38406 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Alexandre Bélanger

comments.content:
Love that town.

Definitely hit the [Art Institute](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706223216/http:/www.artic.edu/aic/index.php). Tremendous Impressionist/Post-Impressionist collection. There’s some great architecture all around too. You may want to check out a walking tour with the [Chicago Architecture Foundation](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706223216/http:/www.architecture.org/).

Oh and if you’re into funny, gotta catch a mainstage show at [Second City](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706223216/http:/www.secondcity.com/?id=theatres/chicago/mainstage).
and how could I forget [Chicago Center for the Print](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706223216/http:/www.prints-posters.com/index.htm).
You might also want to check out [Columbia College Chicago’s Center for Book and Paper Arts](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706223216/http:/www.colum.edu/Book_and_Paper/).
when are you planning on coming? the field museum is supposed to have a big exhibition of maps starting november second.

Powell’s Book Stores. Especially the one near the Uni.

. . .  
Bert Vanderveen BNO

Thanks everyone for all your suggestions. I’m quite interested in all you mentioned. The problem will be the schedule now… But that’s an happy problem!

Jackson, we’ll be there from November 8 through November 12-13, so it may be short for the exhibition…

Once again, thanks a lot.
